Fury is not in me. The wrath of the Lord, which once hung over the unrighteous of his covenant people, has been lifted, and now he seeks to defend his vineyard (contrast Isa. 5:5-7, 25).

briers/thorns. The enemies of the Lord's people. As briers and thorns hamper the growth of the vineyard, so Israel's enemies attempt to halt the growth of the Lord's vineyard (7:23-25). Briers and thorns were previously allowed to grow in the vineyard (5:6; 32:13), but now they are removed.

I would burn them. The Lord at his coming will act against the wicked, overcoming all who oppose him by destroying them with fire (10:17; 26:11); this destruction will be as simple as burning the briers and thorns in a vineyard.
